meanings.definition: Repossession: the action of taking back an item that was bought on credit when the buyer fails to make payments
meanings.sent1: The repo of the car happened after the owner missed several payments.
meanings.sent2: The bank had to do a repo of the furniture when the customer defaulted on the loan.
meanings.sent3: The repo of the TV made the living room feel empty.
meanings.sent4: The repo of the bike was a harsh reminder of financial responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The repo of the laptop left a void in the owner's daily routine.

meanings.definition: Repurchase: to buy back something that was previously sold
meanings.sent1: She decided to repo the antique vase she had sold last year.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to repo the shares they sold to investors.
meanings.sent3: It was a strange feeling to repo the old bicycle from the neighbor.
meanings.sent4: He had to repo his childhood toy collection due to sentimental reasons.
meanings.sent5: The artist wanted to repo the painting to make some improvements.

meanings.definition: Repository: a place where things are stored or kept for safekeeping
meanings.sent1: The library served as a repo for countless books and manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The museum's archives function as a repo for historical artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The fridge became a repo for leftovers after the party.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a repo of memories, both good and bad.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse acted as a repo for surplus inventory.
